name: Chest (Pectorals)
description: The pectoral muscles are responsible for pushing movements and arm adduction across the body.
primaryFunction: Horizontal adduction, flexion, and internal rotation of the arm

commonInjuries.symptoms: Sharp pain during pushing movements, tenderness, possible bruising
commonInjuries.prevention: Proper warm-up, gradual progression, balanced training with pulling exercises

commonInjuries.symptoms: Pain when lifting arms overhead, weakness in shoulder
commonInjuries.prevention: Maintain good posture, strengthen rear deltoids, avoid overuse

tips: Focus on full range of motion during chest exercises
Balance pushing movements with pulling exercises
Incorporate both incline and decline angles for complete development

name: Shoulders (Deltoids)
description: The deltoid muscles provide shoulder stability and enable a wide range of arm movements.

commonInjuries.symptoms: Deep aching pain, weakness when lifting arm, night pain
commonInjuries.prevention: Strengthen rotator cuff muscles, avoid overhead repetitive motions, proper form

commonInjuries.symptoms: Pain and swelling in shoulder, limited range of motion
commonInjuries.prevention: Avoid repetitive overhead activities, maintain good posture

tips: Warm up thoroughly before shoulder workouts
Include rotator cuff strengthening exercises
Avoid excessive overhead pressing without proper progression

name: Biceps
description: The biceps brachii muscles are responsible for elbow flexion and forearm supination.

commonInjuries.symptoms: Pain in front of shoulder, weakness in arm, aching sensation
commonInjuries.prevention: Avoid overuse, proper warm-up, gradual progression

commonInjuries.symptoms: Sudden sharp pain, muscle spasm, tenderness
commonInjuries.prevention: Proper warm-up, don't lift beyond capacity, balanced training

tips: Use full range of motion for maximum muscle development
Don't neglect triceps training for balanced arm development
Focus on controlled movements rather than heavy weights

name: Forearms
description: The forearm muscles control wrist and finger movements, providing grip strength.
primaryFunction: Wrist flexion, extension, and grip strength

commonInjuries.symptoms: Pain on outside of elbow, weak grip strength, pain when lifting
commonInjuries.prevention: Proper grip technique, gradual progression, rest when needed

commonInjuries.symptoms: Pain on inside of elbow, stiffness, numbness in fingers
commonInjuries.prevention: Proper form, strengthen forearm muscles, adequate rest

tips: Include wrist curls and reverse curls in your routine
Use proper grip during all exercises
Don't neglect forearm stretching after workouts

name: Abs (Rectus Abdominis)
description: The rectus abdominis provides core stability and enables trunk flexion.

commonInjuries.symptoms: Sharp pain in abdomen, muscle spasm, difficulty moving
commonInjuries.prevention: Proper warm-up, gradual progression, avoid overexertion

commonInjuries.symptoms: Lower back pain, stiffness, muscle spasms
commonInjuries.prevention: Strengthen core muscles, maintain proper form, balanced training

tips: Focus on quality over quantity for ab exercises
Include both static and dynamic core exercises
Breathe properly during core training

name: Quadriceps
description: The quadriceps muscles are responsible for knee extension and hip flexion.

commonInjuries.symptoms: Sudden sharp pain, muscle spasm, difficulty walking
commonInjuries.prevention: Proper warm-up, gradual progression, adequate rest

commonInjuries.symptoms: Knee pain, especially when squatting or climbing stairs
commonInjuries.prevention: Strengthen quads and glutes, proper form, avoid overuse

tips: Include both compound and isolation quad exercises
Don't neglect hamstring training for muscle balance
Focus on proper squat and lunge form

name: Calves
description: The calf muscles provide propulsion during walking and running, and help maintain balance.
primaryFunction: Plantar flexion and propulsion during movement

commonInjuries.symptoms: Sudden sharp pain, muscle spasm, difficulty walking
commonInjuries.prevention: Proper warm-up, gradual progression, adequate stretching

commonInjuries.symptoms: Pain and stiffness in Achilles tendon, swelling
commonInjuries.prevention: Gradual training progression, proper footwear, calf stretching

tips: Train calves with both seated and standing exercises
Use full range of motion for maximum development
Don't forget to stretch calves after training

name: Traps (Trapezius)
description: The trapezius muscles support the neck and shoulders, enabling shoulder blade movement.
primaryFunction: Shoulder blade elevation, retraction, and rotation

commonInjuries.symptoms: Neck pain, stiffness, limited range of motion
commonInjuries.prevention: Maintain good posture, avoid sudden movements, proper ergonomics

commonInjuries.symptoms: Muscle spasm, pain, tension in upper back
commonInjuries.prevention: Regular stretching, stress management, proper posture

tips: Include both upper and lower trap exercises
Focus on posture correction exercises
Don't neglect neck stretching and mobility

name: Upper Back (Rhomboids)
description: The rhomboid muscles help retract the shoulder blades and maintain proper posture.

commonInjuries.symptoms: Pain between shoulder blades, muscle spasm, limited mobility
commonInjuries.prevention: Strengthen upper back, improve posture, regular stretching

commonInjuries.symptoms: Forward head posture, rounded shoulders, upper back pain
commonInjuries.prevention: Strengthen rear delts and rhomboids, stretch chest and neck

tips: Focus on rowing movements for rhomboid development
Incorporate posture correction exercises
Balance pushing exercises with pulling movements

name: Lats (Latissimus Dorsi)
description: The latissimus dorsi are large back muscles responsible for pulling movements.
primaryFunction: Shoulder adduction, extension, and internal rotation

commonInjuries.symptoms: Pain in back and armpit area, limited shoulder mobility
commonInjuries.prevention: Proper warm-up, gradual progression, balanced training

commonInjuries.symptoms: Pain during overhead movements, weakness, clicking sounds
commonInjuries.prevention: Strengthen rotator cuff, improve shoulder mobility, proper form

tips: Include both vertical and horizontal pulling exercises
Focus on lat stretches for improved mobility
Use full range of motion for maximum development

name: Triceps
description: The triceps muscles are responsible for elbow extension and assist in shoulder stability.

commonInjuries.symptoms: Pain in back of elbow, weakness, aching sensation
commonInjuries.prevention: Proper warm-up, avoid overuse, gradual progression

commonInjuries.symptoms: Swelling in elbow, pain, limited range of motion
commonInjuries.prevention: Avoid repetitive pressure on elbow, proper form

tips: Include both overhead and behind-the-back tricep exercises
Don't neglect tricep stretching after workouts
Balance tricep training with bicep development

name: Lower Back (Erector Spinae)
description: The erector spinae muscles support the spine and enable back extension.

commonInjuries.symptoms: Sharp pain in lower back, muscle spasms, limited mobility
commonInjuries.prevention: Strengthen core, proper lifting technique, maintain flexibility

commonInjuries.symptoms: Radiating pain, numbness, weakness in legs
commonInjuries.prevention: Proper form, avoid heavy lifting with poor technique, core strengthening

tips: Focus on proper deadlift and squat form
Include lower back stretches in your routine
Strengthen your core to support the lower back

name: Glutes (Gluteus Maximus)
description: The gluteus maximus is the largest muscle in the body, responsible for hip extension and stability.
primaryFunction: Hip extension, external rotation, and stabilization

commonInjuries.symptoms: Pain in buttocks, difficulty sitting, muscle spasm
commonInjuries.prevention: Proper warm-up, gradual progression, hip mobility work

commonInjuries.symptoms: Deep buttock pain, sciatic-like symptoms, numbness
commonInjuries.prevention: Hip stretching, strengthen glutes, avoid prolonged sitting

tips: Include both bilateral and unilateral glute exercises
Focus on activating glutes before leg workouts
Don't neglect hip mobility and stretching

name: Hamstrings
description: The hamstring muscles enable knee flexion and hip extension, working as stabilizers during movement.

commonInjuries.symptoms: Sudden sharp pain, muscle spasm, difficulty walking
commonInjuries.prevention: Proper warm-up, maintain hamstring flexibility, balanced training

commonInjuries.symptoms: Pain in back of thigh, stiffness, aching sensation
commonInjuries.prevention: Gradual progression, proper stretching, avoid overuse

tips: Include both knee flexion and hip extension exercises
Maintain good hamstring flexibility with regular stretching
Balance quadriceps and hamstring strength ratios
